results.title: Cocaine pain
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell and J Gary Mitchell Film Company
results.brief_description: This film is a documentary that takes a startling look at coke addiction. It examines how cocaine dominates the life of the users, damages their health, impairs their mental capabilities, alienates their friends and families, and consumes millions of their dollars.

results.title: Cocaine blues
results.creator_credit: John Langley, Malcolm Barbour and Barbour Langley Productions
results.brief_description: An estimated 22 million Americans have tried or are current users of cocaine. Written and produced for contemporary audiences of all ages, “Cocaine Blues” offers a graphic and honest perspective on cocaine’s history, effects and cultural impact in America. The film includes interviews with medical and legal experts, undercover figures and “average” Americans.

results.title: Cobra Verde = Slave coast [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Lucki Stipetic, Ghana Film Industry Corporation, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: Set in the early nineteenth century, Cobra Verde moves from Brazil to Dahomey in West Africa. Francisco Manoel de Silva, an historical figure at the centre of the novel, is amalgamated with that of the bandit Cobra Verde to serve Herzog’s private mythologising. But Verde is not as distinctly drawn as the obsessive characters played by Klaus Kinski in ‘Aguirre’ and ‘Fitzcarraldo’, the Herzog films with which Cobra Verde can be most directly compared. Loosely improvised and more of ‘a happening’, ‘Cobra Verde’ has some extraordinary scenes and magnificent images. The historical issues of slavery and colonialism are typically (for Herzog) subsumed in a mystico-spiritual game. Cast also includes King Ampaw, Jose Lewgoy and Salvatore Basile. In German with English subtitles. Based on the novel “The Viceroy of Ouidah” by Bruce Chatwin.

results.title: Coastal dunes
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Uses an experimental approach to explain the process of saltation (sand movement) in a typical English coastal dune system. Also explains the interrelationships that exist between vegetation and soil type - the changing nature of these two elements is shown by a transect taken across a typical dune system.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International

results.title: Coastal command
results.creator_credit: J.B. Holmes, Ian Dalrymple and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: This feature-length documentary film gives a dramatic account of the activities of the Coastal Command of the Royal Air Force during World War II. The organisation of the Command is seen at the control base, and the work of the Sunderland flying boats and Catalinas on patrol. The film shows a number of encounters with enemy ships, submarines and aircraft culminating in the sighting and sinking of the German raider “Bismarck” by Sunderlands of Coastal Command.

results.title: Coals Coals (Horses and Carts)
results.creator_credit: David Pitt, Francis Gysin and National Coal Board
results.brief_description: The last of the horse-drawn delivery drays of Charringtons. The film is a nostalgic record of the work of the horses and delivery men. There is no glamour, the stables are scruffy, the men dirty, but the horses are immaculate. The title comes from a music-hall song which provides the background music.

results.title: Coal: the rock that burns
results.brief_description: Discusses the formation of coal, its location throughout the world, types of coal, mining, reclaiming stripminded land and the by-products of coal. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Coal valley
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents the case for small scale private mining by examining the independence, ingenuity and engineering skill of the men who built and work five small privately owned coal mines on the west coast of New Zealand’s South Island. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Coal mining today
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Information and New Realm
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film showing how Britain trains young miners in the skills necessary for operating new coal-mining machinery. Also details the uses of coal.

results.title: Coal Miner's Daughter
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Bernard Schwartz and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the autobiography of the same name by country and western legend Loretta Lynn, the film traces her beginnings in the Appalachia backwoods, her marriage when still a child, and her eventual arrival in Nashville. From there she launches her career and becomes one of America’s most successful recording artists. The film is notable for its evocative depiction of poverty in the Deep South, and the winning portrayal of Lynn by Sissy Spacek (who won an Academy Award for her role). Cast also includes Tommy Lee Jones, Levon Helm and Beverly D’Angelo in a cameo as Patsy Cline. The soundtrack features a selection of country and western classics.
